taxonConcepts.nameAccordingTo: Species 2000 & ITIS Catalogue of Life: April 2013

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Primarily found in brackish water but known to tolerate fresh or marine waters for short periods (Ref. 48490).  Found in large rivers, reservoirs, lagoons and estuaries.  Feed on filamentous algae, plant material and insects.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Western Indian Ocean:  India and Sri Lanka.
dataObjects.references: Talwar, P.K. and A.G. Jhingran 1991 Inland fishes of India and adjacent countries. Volume 2. A.A. Balkema, Rotterdam. (Ref. 4833)

dataObjects.description:
Depth range based on 2 specimens in 1 taxon.

Environmental ranges
  Depth range (m): 0.6 - 1

Graphical representation

Depth range (m): 0.6 - 1
 
Note: this information has not been validated. Check this *note*. Your feedback is most welcome.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#LifeCycle
dataObjects.description: After spawning, about 500 eggs are laid and attached to a submerged log, rock or sometimes roots and weeds, in still or slow flowing water. Parents guard and fan the eggs until hatching, usually about 4 days. The fry shoal around their parents during the first weeks of growth. Parents refrain from feeding from the time of spawning until the fry become independent.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Uses
dataObjects.title: Importance
dataObjects.description: fisheries: commercial; aquaculture: commercial; aquarium: commercial
